about.title: Our Story
about.text_1: Capogrossi was born in Rome, Italy. In 1922, a family founded a quaint restaurant in the heart of Fluminicino. With almost a for a century of presence, Capogrossi keeps intact his essence, its tradicional flavors and grandmas classic recipes Philomena, icon of Roman cuisine.
about.text_2: 100 years after its inauguration, its charm travels thousands of times. Kilometers to open their doors in Santiago de Chile hand in hand the prestigious chefs Andrea Bernardi y Fernanda Fuentes, both currently awarded a Michelin star in their Nub restaurant (Canary islands).
about.text_3: In this restaurant, our chefs come to fuse the Grandma Filomena tradition, her memories and root with its modernity and gastronomic innovation, always maintaining the unwavering flavors of the diet Italian Mediterranean

gallery.description_1: 100% MADE IN ITALY RECIPES, AUTHENTIC BY NONNA FILOMENA.
gallery.description_2: LED BY OUR CHEF FERNANDA FUENTES (THE FIRST CHILEAN TO BE AWARDED A MICHELIN STAR) AND ANDREA BERNARDI.
gallery.description_3: WE WILL HAVE ONE OF THE BEST BARTENDERS IN CHILE.

item_1.title: Chitarra al Pesto di Sorrento
item_1.paragraph: Fresh pesto based on white almonds and fresh season lemon. Served in dry Chitarra pasta and finished with toasted almonds.

item_2.title: Spaghetti Pomodoro dei tre re
item_2.paragraph: Mancini dry long pasta, flavoured with garlic, daterino tomatoes sautéed in EVO oil and in a sauce of three Italian tomatoes.

item_3.title: Burrata with oleo al carbone
item_3.paragraph: Fresh cow's milk cheese, candied porcini mushrooms, warm guanciale slices, semi-dried tomatoes finished with charcoal-flavoured oil and smoked with cherry wood.
